plethora.core

Class Ple_Agent

  • java.lang.Object
    • plethora.core.Ple_Agent

  • public class Ple_Agent
extends java.lang.Object
    This is an Agent Class. It works based on steering behaviors by Craig Reynolds implemented by Daniel Shiffman and Karsten Schmidt and vector movements inspired Langton's Ant. The Class uses toxiclibs, so please make sure you have toxiclibs installed. Check the example folder for more documentation. The class works with the Ple_Terrain class, allowing terrain evaluation. Written my Jose Sanchez - 2011 for feedback please contact me at: jomasan@gmail.com
    Author:
    jomasan

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ple_Agent

        public Ple_Agent(processing.core.PApplet _p5,
         Vec3D _loc)
        Basic constructor. Provide the PApplet refernce. (type 'this'). and the initial location of the agent. By default agents will start without any initial velocity.
        Parameters:
        _p5 -
        _loc -

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update()
        Method to update location. Addes the acceleration (acc) to the velocity which gets passed to the location. The movement has momentum based on the acumulated velocity. Also has a maxspeed Value, that can be changed with the getter and setter methods.

      • flatten

        public void flatten(float zValue)
        Allow to make2D. Will collapse the z values of the locations to the value provided.
        Parameters:
        zValue - - Value for location z.

      • flatVel

        public void flatVel()
        Allows to flatten the velocity in order to get a 2D movement.

      • updateSimple

        public void updateSimple()
        Method to update the location only by adding the velocity to the location. This simple update allows for more 'mechanical' movements, not having the momentum of acceleration.

      • terrainPointsInRange

        public java.util.ArrayList terrainPointsInRange(Ple_Terrain ter,
                                       float minRange,
                                       float maxRange,
                                       float minAngle,
                                       float maxAngle)
        This method searches for points in the Terrain class within certain range and angle.
        Parameters:
        ter -
        minRange - - minimum distance
        maxRange - - maximum distance
        minAngle - - minimum angle
        maxAngle - - maximum angle
        Returns:

      • terrainIndexInRange

        public java.util.ArrayList terrainIndexInRange(Ple_Terrain ter,
                                      float[][] dataMap,
                                      float minRange,
                                      float maxRange,
                                      float minAngle,
                                      float maxAngle)
        This method evaluates points in range and associates the data map with their location. It returns an arrayList of Ple_Nodes with both location and data.
        Parameters:
        ter - - Terrain of reference
        dataMap - - 2 dimentional array that contains the info to be associated to the points.
        minRange - - minimum distance
        maxRange - - maximum distance
        minAngle - - minimum angle
        maxAngle - - maximum angle
        Returns:

        public void updateAnchor(float stiffness,
                float damping,
                float threshold,
                boolean show)
        calculates the spring if the 'drop anchor method has been activated'
        Parameters:
        stiffness - - stiffness of the spring
        damping - - damping of the spring
        threshold - - distance to the anchor
        show - - display a line for the spring

      • setFree

        public void setFree()
        This method will release the anchor.

      • drawTrail

        public void drawTrail(float thresh)
        This method will draw the Trail if the dropTrail method is activated. Make sure to have a trail to draw! (initTail).
        Parameters:
        thresh - - this threshold allows for not drawing the lines longer than certain distance. Useful when using a wrapparound space border.

      • dropTrail

        public void dropTrail(int every,
             int limit)
        This method allows for dropping a location vector to a list in order to generate a trail.
        Parameters:
        every - - drop vector every so many frames
        limit - - limit the maximum number of drops.

      • closestNormalToSpline

        public Vec3D closestNormalToSpline(Spline3D sp,
                          Vec3D v)
        Method to calculate the normal to a spline based on the individual line segments of the spline. It returns the closest normal.
        Parameters:
        sp - - Spline3D to test
        v - - vector to test
        Returns:

      • closestNormalandDirectionToSpline

        public Vec3D closestNormalandDirectionToSpline(Spline3D sp,
                                      Vec3D v,
                                      float amountOfDir)
        Returns the normal to the spline plus the direction of the line, allows to flow along a line.
        Parameters:
        sp - - Spline3D to test
        v - - vector to test
        amountOfDir - - amount of directionality added to the normal vector.
        Returns:

      • displayTailPoints

        public void displayTailPoints(float r1,
                     float g1,
                     float b1,
                     float al1,
                     float s1,
                     float r2,
                     float g2,
                     float b2,
                     float al2,
                     float s2)
        Display the points of the tails. It allows to use different styles at begining and end.
        Parameters:
        r1 - - red start.
        g1 - - green start.
        b1 - - blue start
        al1 - - alpha start
        s1 - - size start.
        r2 - - red end.
        g2 - - green end.
        b2 - - blue end.
        al2 - - alpha end.
        s2 - - size end.

      • wrapSpace

        public void wrapSpace(float dX,
             float dY,
             float dZ)
        Boundary for agents. Agents will reappear in the opposite side. Wrap-Space.
        Parameters:
        dX - - bound for X, from -dX to dX.
        dY - - bound for Y, from -dY to dY.
        dZ - - bound for Z, from -dZ to dZ.

      • bounceSpace

               float dY,

        Parameters:
        dX - - bound for X, from -dX to dX.
        dY - - bound for Y, from -dY to dY.
        dZ - - bound for Z, from -dZ to dZ.

      • drawBeziersBetweenTails

        public void drawBeziersBetweenTails(java.util.ArrayList<Ple_Agent> boids,
                           float fromDist,
                           float toDist,
                           float scale1,
                           float scale2)
        draws beziers between tail points, needs both tail and velocity tail.
        Parameters:
        boids - - list of agents
        fromDist - - min distance
        toDist - - max distance
        scale1 - - scale of the bezier handle 1 based on velocity tail.
        scale2 - - scale of the bezier handle 2 based on velocity tail.

      • wander2D

        public void wander2D(float wanderR,
            float wanderD,
            float change)
        Wander behaivior in 2D. Based on the script by Daniel Shiffman on Craig Reynolds agents.
        Parameters:
        wanderR - - wander Radius.
        wanderD - - wander distance.
        change - - amount of change.

      • Occilate2D

        public void Occilate2D(float wanderR,
              float wanderD,
              float amplitude,
              float period,
              float strength)
        Parameters:
        wanderR - - wander Radius.
        wanderD - - wander distance.
        amplitude - - amplitud of the occilation wave.
        period - - period of the occilation wave.
        strength - - how strong is the force of occilation.

        Parameters:

        wanderD - - wander distance.
        amplitude - - amplitud of the occilation wave.

        strength - - how strong is the force of occilation.
        occHeight - - height amplitud of occilation.

      • flock

        public void flock(java.util.ArrayList<Ple_Agent> boids,
         float desCoh,
         float desAli,
         float desSep,
         float cohScale,
         float aliScale,
         float sepScale)
        Flock method contains a distance check to calculate Cohesion-Alignment-Separation based on Craig Reynolds Flock algorithm Code based on Daniel Shiffman and Karsten Schmidt (toxi)

        boids -
        desCoh -
        desAli -
        desSep -
        cohScale -
        aliScale -
        sepScale -
        bCoh - - activate cohesion
        cAli - - activate alignment
        bSep - - activate separation
